g501.definition: [ἀντλέω] from ἄντλος (the hold of a ship); to bale up (properly, bilge water), i.e. dip water (with a bucket, pitcher, etc.)

g503.definition: [ἀντοφθαλμέω] from a compound of {{g473}} and {{g3788}}; to face

g504.definition: [ἄνυδρος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g5204}}; waterless, i.e. dry

g505.definition: [ἀνυπόκριτος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of {{g5271}}; undissembled, i.e. sincere

g506.definition: [ἀνυπότακτος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of {{g5293}}; unsubdued, i.e. insubordinate (in fact or temper)

g507.definition: [ἄνω] adverb from {{g473}}; upward or on the top

g508.definition: [ἀνώγεον] from {{g507}} and {{g1093}}; above the ground, i.e. (properly) the second floor of a building; used for a dome or a balcony on the upper story

g509.definition: [ἄνωθεν] from {{g507}}; from above; by analogy, from the first; by implication, anew

g511.definition: [ἀνώτερος] comparative degree of {{g507}}; upper, i.e. (neuter as adverb) to a more conspicuous place, in a former part of the book

g512.definition: [ἀνωφελής] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and the base of {{g5624}}; useless or (neuter) inutility

g513.definition: [ἀξίνη] probably from ἄγνυμι (to break; compare {{g4486}}); an axe

g514.definition: [ἄξιος] probably from {{g71}}; deserving, comparable or suitable (as if drawing praise)

g515.definition: [ἀξιόω] from {{g514}}; to deem entitled or fit

g517.definition: [ἀόρατος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g3707}}; invisible

g518.definition: [ἀπαγγέλλω] from {{g575}} and the base of {{g32}}; to announce

g519.definition: [ἀπάγχομαι] from {{g575}} and ἄγχω (to choke; akin to the base of {{g43}}); to strangle oneself off (i.e. to death)

g520.definition: [ἀπάγω] from {{g575}} and {{g71}}; to take off (in various senses)

g521.definition: [ἀπαίδευτος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of {{g3811}}; uninstructed, i.e. (figuratively) stupid

g522.definition: [ἀπαίρω] from {{g575}} and {{g142}}; to lift off, i.e. remove

g524.definition: [ἀπαλγέω] from {{g575}} and ἀλγέω (to smart); to grieve out, i.e. become apathetic

g525.definition: [ἀπαλλάσσω] from {{g575}} and {{g236}}; to change away, i.e. release, (reflexively) remove

g526.definition: [ἀπαλλοτριόω] from {{g575}} and a derivative of {{g245}}; to estrange away, i.e. (passively and figuratively) to be non-participant

g528.definition: [ἀπαντάω] from {{g575}} and a derivative of {{g473}}; to meet away, i.e. encounter

g530.definition: [ἅπαξ] probably from {{g537}}; one (or a single) time (numerically or conclusively)

g531.definition: [ἀπαράβατος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of {{g3845}}; not passing away, i.e. untransferable (perpetual)

g532.definition: [ἀπαρασκεύαστος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a derivative of {{g3903}}; unready

g533.definition: [ἀπαρνέομαι] from {{g575}} and {{g720}}; to deny utterly, i.e. disown, abstain

g534.definition: [ἀπάρτι] from {{g575}} and {{g737}}; from now, i.e. henceforth (already)

g536.definition: [ἀπαρχή] from a compound of {{g575}} and {{g756}}; a beginning of sacrifice, i.e. the (Jewish) first-fruit (figuratively)

g537.definition: [ἅπας] from {{g1}} (as a particle of union) and {{g3956}}; absolutely all or (singular) every one

g538.definition: [ἀπατάω] of uncertain derivation; to cheat, i.e. delude

g540.definition: [ἀπάτωρ] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g3962}}; fatherless, i.e. of unrecorded paternity

g541.definition: [ἀπαύγασμα] from a compound of {{g575}} and {{g826}}; an off-flash, i.e. effulgence

g542.definition: [ἀπείδω] from {{g575}} and the same as {{g1492}}; to see fully

g545.definition: [ἀπειθής] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g3982}}; unpersuadable, i.e. contumacious

g546.definition: [ἀπειλέω] of uncertain derivation; to menace; by implication, to forbid

g548.definition: [ἄπειμι] from {{g575}} and {{g1510}}; to be away Compare {{g549}}.

g549.definition: [ἄπειμι] from {{g575}} and εἶμι (to go); to go away Compare {{g548}}.

g550.definition: [ἀπειπόμην] reflexive past of a compound of {{g575}} and {{g2036}}; to say off for oneself, i.e. disown

g551.definition: [ἀπείραστος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of {{g3987}}; untried, i.e. not temptable

g552.definition: [ἄπειρος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g3984}}; inexperienced, i.e. ignorant

g554.definition: [ἀπεκδύομαι] middle voice from {{g575}} and {{g1562}}; to divest wholly oneself, or (for oneself) despoil

g557.definition: [ἀπελεγμός] from a compound of {{g575}} and {{g1651}}; refutation, i.e. (by implication) contempt

g558.definition: [ἀπελεύθερος] from {{g575}} and {{g1658}}; one freed away, i.e. a freedman

g559.definition: [Ἀπελλῆς] of Latin origin; Apelles, a Christian

g560.definition: [ἀπελπίζω] from {{g575}} and {{g1679}}; to hope out, i.e. fully expect

g561.definition: [ἀπέναντι] from {{g575}} and {{g1725}}; from in front, i.e. opposite, before or against

g562.definition: [ἀπέραντος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a secondary derivative of {{g4008}}; unfinished, i.e. (by implication) interminable

g563.definition: [ἀπερισπάστως] adverb from a compound of {{g1}} (as a negative participle) and a presumed derivative of {{g4049}}; undistractedly, i.e. free from (domestic) solicitude

g564.definition: [ἀπερίτμητος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and a presumed derivative of {{g4059}}; uncircumcised (figuratively)

g565.definition: [ἀπέρχομαι] from {{g575}} and {{g2064}}; to go off (i.e. depart), aside (i.e. apart) or behind (i.e. follow), literally or figuratively

g566.definition: [ἀπέχει] third person singular present indicative active of {{g568}} used impersonally; it is sufficient

g567.definition: [ἀπέχομαι] middle voice (reflexively) of {{g568}}; to hold oneself off, i.e. refrain

g568.definition: [ἀπέχω] from {{g575}} and {{g2192}}; (actively) to have out, i.e. receive in full; (intransitively) to keep (oneself) away, i.e. be distant (literally or figuratively)

g569.definition: [ἀπιστέω] from {{g571}}; to be unbelieving, i.e. (transitively) disbelieve, or (by implication) disobey

g570.definition: [ἀπιστία] from {{g571}}; faithlessness, i.e. (negatively) disbelief (lack of Christian faith), or (positively) unfaithfulness (disobedience)

g571.definition: [ἄπιστος] from {{g1}} (as a negative particle) and {{g4103}}; (actively) disbelieving, i.e. without Christian faith (specially, a heathen); (passively) untrustworthy (person), or incredible (thing)

g572.definition: [ἁπλότης] from {{g573}}; singleness, i.e. (subjectively) sincerity (without dissimulation or self-seeking), or (objectively) generosity (copious bestowal)

g573.definition: [ἁπλοῦς] probably from {{g1}} (as a particle of union) and the base of {{g4120}}; properly, folded together, i.e. single (figuratively, clear)

g574.definition: [ἁπλῶς] adverb from {{g573}} (in the objective sense of {{g572}}); bountifully;

g575.definition: [ἀπό] a primary particle; "off," i.e. away (from something near), in various senses (of place, time, or relation; literal or figurative) In composition (as a prefix) it usually denotes separation, departure, cessation, completion, reversal, etc.

g576.definition: [ἀποβαίνω] from {{g575}} and the base of {{g939}}; literally, to disembark; figuratively, to eventuate

g577.definition: [ἀποβάλλω] from {{g575}} and {{g906}}; to throw off; figuratively, to lose

g578.definition: [ἀποβλέπω] from {{g575}} and {{g991}}; to look away from everything else, i.e. (figuratively) intently regard

g579.definition: [ἀπόβλητος] from {{g577}}; cast off, i.e. (figuratively) such as to be rejected

g581.definition: [ἀπογενόμενος] past participle of a compound of {{g575}} and {{g1096}}; absent, i.e. deceased (figuratively, renounced)

g582.definition: [ἀπογραφή] from {{g583}}; an enrollment; by implication, an assessment

g583.definition: [ἀπογράφω] from {{g575}} and {{g1125}}; to write off (a copy or list), i.e. enrol

g584.definition: [ἀποδείκνυμι] from {{g575}} and {{g1166}}; to show off, i.e. exhibit; figuratively, to demonstrate, i.e. accredit

g586.definition: [ἀποδεκατόω] from {{g575}} and {{g1183}}; to tithe (as debtor or creditor)

g588.definition: [ἀποδέχομαι] from {{g575}} and {{g1209}}; to take fully, i.e. welcome (persons), approve (things)

g589.definition: [ἀποδημέω] from {{g590}}; to go abroad, i.e. visit a foreign land

g590.definition: [ἀπόδημος] from {{g575}} and {{g1218}}; absent from one's own people, i.e. a foreign traveller

g591.definition: [ἀποδίδωμι] from {{g575}} and {{g1325}}; to give away, i.e. up, over, back, etc. (in various applications)

g592.definition: [ἀποδιορίζω] from {{g575}} and a compound of {{g1223}} and {{g3724}}; to disjoin (by a boundary, figuratively, a party)

g593.definition: [ἀποδοκιμάζω] from {{g575}} and {{g1381}}; to disapprove, i.e. (by implication) to repudiate

g595.definition: [ἀπόθεσις] from {{g659}}; a laying aside (literally or figuratively)

g598.definition: [ἀποθλίβω] from {{g575}} and {{g2346}}; to crowd (from every side)

g599.definition: [ἀποθνήσκω] from {{g575}} and {{g2348}}; to die off (literally or figuratively)

g600.definition: [ἀποκαθίστημι] from {{g575}} and {{g2525}}; to reconstitute (in health, home or organization)
